We feel a huge sense of pride when our designs excite the people around us, and we can't wait to share with you audio like you've never seen.We set out to build a game changing product, maybe not one the entire world would notice, but one significant enough to be noticed.What risks and challenges do we face?Our primary challenge is finding or creating a space large enough to keep pace with the amount of orders we receive. A living room and garage provide ample space for small orders, but to ensure streamlined processes and on-time delivery for larger volumes, a dedicated office and warehouse is needed. Fortunately this issue is easily resolved: Phoenix has an ample supply of warehouse and commercial office space. Finding the right space to meet the demands of our customers is a simple matter of picking the best one.While there are challenges we will likely face, we see very little in the way of potential risks. We have multiple suppliers and partners ready for all components of the PANL1 speakers; the R&D has already been done; we have already delivered systems to first run customers and they were assembled using the same processes we plan to use for these systems. We foresee very little risk to for a late delivery or non-delivery. Outside of catastrophic natural disasters, very little can interfere with us delivering the PANL1 to you.

story:
Inside us all is a musician waiting to get out. Trouble is, learning a musical instrument can be tricky. If you’ve never played before, almost everything about it seems daunting; from where to put your hands; to sheet music that seems like it was designed to make it harder for you. Not to mention the years and years of practice.

We designed Skwitch to let everyone play, explore and create music. With just a single button, it's easy - you'll be making music in minutes. 

 

Skwitch is a clever new music-making gadget & app from the hardworking folks at Skoogmusic.  It clips straight on to your iPhone and uses the onboard sensors to create a one-button musical instrument that is responsive, expressive and amazingly versatile. Just press the button to play notes. It’s that easy. 

 

Play, Explore and Create

 

 

With Skwitch and the Skwitch Music app you can:

PLAY ready-made songs, one note at a time, just by pressing the Skwitch.  You set the tempo and how each note sounds - the app takes care of the rest.  Start slow and build up the pace when you are ready. 

 


 

EXPLORE music in a new way. Learn by playing with sound, expression and timing. Discover your own musicality and build confidence in your own musical abilities.

 

 

CREATE your own riffs and grooves using our simple note editor.  Just pick a key, add some notes, then drag up or down to form your riff, and get ready to rock out like a pro.

 

 

SKWITCH IS FOR EVERYONE

Skwitch is for anyone looking to build confidence in their musical abilities; from aspiring musicians looking for a fun, portable way to get into music-making, to music technologists looking for ways to bring new life to their compositions and live sets. Skwitch makes it fun and easy to get started and doesn't require an in-depth understanding of music theory or technique.  With Skwitch you can just dive right in.  

 

 

Skwitch is the only accessory designed specifically to transform your iPhone into a fully expressive, tactile musical instrument.  By harnessing the power of your iPhone, Skwitch becomes a feature-packed expressive music controller with a powerful audio engine, built-in Bluetooth MIDI, stereo loudspeakers & high-quality touchscreen display.

 

UNIQUE TACTILE INTERFACE

Skwitch looks different. With 20mm of squeezable depth, it feels different too. The tactile button is optimised for maximum expressive control, making it easier and more intuitive to play than any other instrument out there. 

 

 

WORKS LIKE MAGIC (BUT ACTUALLY IT'S SCIENCE)

Skwitch is completely passive. It works with sensors inside your iPhone to detect every subtle movement of its soft, tactile button. There are no expensive electronics inside, and no batteries for you to worry about charging. Just clip it on and you'll be amazed at what you can do with it.

 

 

FULLY EXPRESSIVE

Using patented magnetic sensing technology it'll turn the slightest touch on the button into expressive musical sound. Vary your sound by blending filters and effects, or pitch-bending between notes and chords.

 

 

COMPACT, LIGHTWEIGHT AND PORTABLE

Pocket-sized and lightweight, you can take Skwitch anywhere. With no electronics or batteries inside, it’s solidly built and water-resistant - just drop it in your bag on the way out the door.

 

 

SEAMLESS SOFTWARE

The Skwitch Music app was designed to seamlessly integrate the Skwitch with the technology built into your iPhone. The app interacts perfectly with Skwitch, and has in-app guides and videos to help you with everything from getting started to making wireless connections with Bluetooth MIDI.

 

Skwitch is powered by the Skwitch Music app. It’s where you pick how and what you want to play.  Choose songs, create riffs, set up your button, or get creative with other apps and devices. Whatever you choose, our app makes it easy and fun!

 

CHOOSE A SONG:  Pick a song from our collection of starter riffs and songs - you'll be amazed at how quickly you'll be jamming away.  Want to know how "Happy Birthday" sounds in a minor key? Try it. Want to play with friends? Choose a multi-part song and pick a part each - melody, harmony or bass.

 

BUILD YOUR OWN RIFF LIBRARY: With our simple note editor you can build brand new riffs, chords sequences and arpeggios from scratch, in seconds. It'll always keep you in tune, so just add a few notes to start creating. It's like a musical scratchpad and it's brilliant for exploring new ideas - the rewards are instant.

 

CHOOSE HOW TO PLAY:  Use as a single pressure sensitive button or subdivide into up to four playable areas.  You can customise each area to play notes or chords, add pressure sensitive arpeggiation, and you can even choose to play your riffs forward, backward or in random order.

 

 

GET CREATIVE: Unlock your creative potential by connecting to other apps and devices. Expand your sound library, control synths, modulate effects or record your performances in compatible apps running on your Bluetooth MIDI enabled iPad or Mac. 

 

SELF-PACED LEARNING:  Fun, interactive guides and tutorials in the Skwitch Music app cover everything from connecting your Skwitch to riff editing and advanced topics like working with Bluetooth MIDI and MPE.  We're confident you'll pick up the basics just by playing so just move at your own pace and dip into the tutorials when you are ready to try something new.   


 

 

When you back our campaign we’ll ship your Skwitch straight away.  You'll also be invited to take part in a series of week-long app development challenges set by you, where you tell us what new app features you'd like us to work on.

 

 

 

How many times have you heard someone say "I can't sing" or "I haven't got a musical bone in my body".  Our purpose in life is to prove these people wrong.  At Skoogmusic we make musical instruments that anyone can play. We believe that the ability to make music is inside us all and we want to inspire everyone, regardless of age, physical or musical ability to feel musically empowered and to enjoy all the benefits that playing a musical instrument brings.

 

Our team brings together expertise in hardware and software design, sensor technology, coding, audio and music technology, acoustics, education and psychology.  Our first product, Skoog, was originally launched back in 2010.  Working in partnership with schools and educational specialists it was developed as an accessible musical instrument, for anyone who couldn't play a traditional instrument due to physical or cognitive difficulties. 

 

In 2015, we ran a successful funding campaign here on Indiegogo to completely redesign the product.  Skoog 2.0 was delivered to backers within a few months of the campaign close, and we've been shipping worldwide ever since.  Now we're back with a brand new innovation that builds on the engineering, coding and industrial design expertise we've gained along the way.

 

 

 

Skwitch is for everyone, including experienced musicians and technologists. It's a versatile MIDI controller that is arguably the most compact and inexpensive way to add tactile expressive control to your portable music making workflow.


MULTI-FUNCTIONAL HARDWARE CONTROLLER

The Skwitch Music app lets you connect to other devices using Bluetooth MIDI so that you can use Skwitch as a wireless hardware controller for apps, DAWs and plugins. With separate MPE, modulation and fx control modes, it's easy to create a fully customised hardware-software setup.

 

Skwitch is compatible with the leading Bluetooth MIDI compatible apps and DAWs:

 

 

REAL-TIME STEP SEQUENCER & ARPEGGIATOR

With note by note playback and simple sequence editing you can use Skwitch as a real-time  step-sequencer, where you control the timing, duration and expression of every note or chord. Turn on the arpeggiator to play automated note sequences with pressure-mapped rate and expression.

 

 

ADD EXPRESSION WITH MPE

Skwitch turns your iPhone into a highly responsive MPE controller. The soft, squeezable button gives you full expressive control of attack, channel pressure, timbre and release. Use with multiple playing areas to add pitch-bend between notes and chords by changing how you squeeze the button.

 

 

MAPPABLE MODULATION

Connect to your favourite DAW or plugin on iPad or Mac and use Skwitch side by side with any standard keyboard controller.  Add modulation, pitch-bend and channel pressure to your performances, or use as a multi-channel mappable controller for total flexibility.  

 

MUSICAL SCRATCHPAD  

Use the Skwitch Music app like a musical scratchpad. Just add and drag notes around till you create something you like then roll with it. It's great for sparking and capturing ideas when you are out and about, and it's a quick and brilliantly easy way to lay down bass lines or expressive melodies in your DAW. 

 

 

 

Includes: Skwitch, Skwitch Music app, Getting started guide 

App Compatibility: iOS 12.0 and newer

Device Compatibility: iPhone 6S and newer

Additional software for iOS Switch Control users:  Skwitch Access app

Additional lessons for Swift Playground coders: Skwitch, Droids and Drones

 

Skwitch is ready to ship, our app is ready to go, but we need your help with the finishing touches. 

By supporting Skoogmusic's hardworking team of engineers, coders, industrial designers, and musicians, you'll be playing an essential role in helping us fulfil our mission of enabling everyone to play and make music.  

 

 

Our mission is to give everyone the chance to make music, especially those who find traditional instruments difficult or impossible to play.  Over the last 10 years we've been privileged to share in some fantastic musical awakenings with individuals for whom playing a musical instrument had never seemed like an option. It's been an honour to follow these new musicians as they grow in confidence and stretch the boundaries of what is considered possible. 

Without the brilliant and inspirational work of various music therapists, educators, charities and inclusive music practitioners: dedicated to bringing the joy of making music to everyone, none of this would be possible.  

During this campaign we are offering you the chance to donate a Skwitch to one of our musical inclusion heroes. When you select our 'Buy 1 Give 1' perk, we'll ship one Skwitch to you and another to one of our inclusive music partners. We'll let you choose from our selection of inclusive music partners to receive your donation - or if you have someone specific you'd like to donate to, just let us know.

At the end of the campaign you can keep an eye on our blog to see what these little musical squishies are getting up to out in the wild.

 

 

 

What could possibly go wrong?

 

Hardware products are difficult to get off the ground; they're real, not virtual, so they need to be manufactured, which means significant sums have to be spent upfront on tooling and volume production, and a lot can go wrong along the way.  The good news is that our first production run is complete, and the product is fully tested, boxed and ready to ship.  

 

Our first app is up and ready for iOS on the App Store - it works great, and we're looking forward to refining it with your help.  During the Skwitch:lab takeover we'll be playing to the strengths of our experienced development team, who've been developing award-winning apps and products since 2009. 

 

Of course, unforeseen issues do arise during app development; sometimes a task will throw up complications that couldn't have been foreseen; updates or bugs in the operating system can sidetrack development; and occasionally the app review process takes longer than anticipated.  Fortunately we have the expertise in-house to work through any issue that arises. If anything does go dramatically wrong, we'll let you know immediately, but rest assured that the only cost will be time  - you won't miss out on any promised features or updates.

story:
The Jamberry Piquencer

A battery powered compact box with two audio/midi sequencers running on an embedded Linux OS on a Raspberry Pi with a soundcard and a TFT display.

 

Highly playable

Two independant sequencers operate similar to DJ decks.
Chain patterns or phrases, apply probability, create polyrhythms, jump to any step, explore new combinations. Everything quantized.

 

Mix-bus recording built in

Assign each track to one of the four buses by choosing a category and record long jam sessions into audio stems easily for later remixing.

 

Philosophy

Workflow inspired by Dub- and DJ mixing

Designed to encourage unique non-deterministic, non-analytical, non-getting stuck, spontaneous joyful music making on your couch, embracing and recording blissful accidents.

 

Sampling

Record loops from external synthesizers or the internal tracks/buses without stopping the sequencer.

Easily slice audio samples and insert notes to re-arrange the material.

 

Connectivity

Connect external midi-devices via the DIN input/output sockets on the back.

Connect additional Midi-Controllers via the three USB 2.0 ports and configure them with a simple LUA scripting API.

 

The Piquencer Software - Focus on live playability

The sequencer is written in C++ and uses the JUCE library for audio processing to take advantage of the four CPU cores provided by the Raspberry Pi 3.

One eight-track sequencer on each side and a cross-fader allow combining different patterns and phrases in a playful manner.

The sequencing functions include chaining, automation, probability, step jumping, ratcheting (aka snareroll), note repeat, swing and accenting (accenting not yet implemented).

Setting different lenghts- and start points to tracks allows for easy creation of polyrhythms.

Audio-tracks are routed to one of four buses allowing to record separated stems (e.g. drums, bass, keys, fx) to the SD-card in WAV format.

Long WAV files (stems) can be loaded for disk-streaming and cue points added to pattern-tracks.

Notes are inserted either by live recording, toggling steps on a grid or surgical editing in the step-mode.

A visual help menu aids with memorizing key combinations.

Two global effects: Reverb and Delay (tempo synced). The sends are pre-fader.

Can use free open source Effect- and Instrument plug-ins (need to be natively compiled for the ARM7 processor) on instruments. (Assigning to buses and audio input to be implemented soon)

 


Dedicated music machine with the perks of a personal computer

It boots in about about 15 seconds when you turn it on. You do not need to use a mouse, the operating system is not bloated, you do not worry about drivers, OS updates or viruses like you might with a conventional laptop.

1 GB or RAM of which about 850 MB are usable for audio at runtime.

Use free open source Audio- and Instrument plug-ins (if natively compiled for ARM7 processor)

Long audio files can be streamed from disk.

Connect midi-controllers, mice & keyboards or storage devices via the three USB 2.0 sockets.

Transfer files via USB, Wifi or LAN. Simply backup your data with rsync.

The LUA scripting API allows defining custom input/output behavior for midi controllers such as controlling LEDs

Can be optionally powered with a regular micro-USB wall charger.

Buttons function as regular keyboard keys for entering names.

 

Use the Raspberry Pi like a regular PC When connected to an HDMI screen (optional)

Can be optionally configured to dual-boot into Raspian or other Linux dekstop distributions.

This allows to use additional music software such as VCV Rack, Tracktion, Reaper, Audacity, LMMS, Hydrogen and many more on the big screen. (Untested)

Or run office applications, play games, browse the internet etc.

 

Short Summary

I am IvoFX and I like to play and record electronic music. I am also a software developer.

The Jamberry Piquencer is an attempt to stop my Gear Acquisition Syndrome.

For a long time I was looking for a groove-box and purchased a bunch of them. None of them felt like they were sufficiently complete to be "the only one" I would need to serve as the "brain" of my set-up as there was always some feature I missed or some flaw which led me to go and buy another one hoping to fill the gap, leading to the infamous G.A.S. (gear acquisition syndrome) and spending more money.

I pondered about using the Raspberry Pi for music making for a while and when me and my wife moved from London back to Germany I decided to take three to four months off to devote myself to  writing the software and assembling the hardware needed for a standalone portable sequencer.

The Piquencer is my take on what I believe is a good work-flow and set of functionality tailored to my own needs as a user. I assume that it will work equally well for others.

 

What I Need & What You Get

The research and development is taking longer than expected, I am now in month seven. I need funding to continue developing the product for about two more months and get a reasonably polished prototype ready to show at the Musikmesse Frankfurt in the beginning of April to anyone interested in private.

My aim is to build the units by hand and sell them online myself for an estimated price of 300-350 Euros.

By donating, you will receive my dearest gratitude and help to increase the likelihood of the Piquencer becoming a real product - an affordable music box that is not a toy.

 

The Impact

An affordable music-box becomes available to the general public. Music gear tends to be very expensive.


I would love to be able to make a living off this product, selling the units and continuing to develop the software. I have many more ideas and plans for the future, such as allowing users to connect and jam online via wifi, as well as adding internal synthesizers and more effects.

 

Risks & Challenges

I have encountered and overcome many technical hurdles during development and I keep worrying that something might occur that would make it impossible to complete the project. It is looking good so far however.

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word!

 

 

Thank you,

IvoFX

 

I made some video recordings to show how patterns can be quickly created from scratch:

Designed to encourage unique non-deterministic, non-analytical, non-getting stuck, spontaneous joyful music making on your couch, embracing and recording blissful accidents.
 

Sampling
Record loops from external synthesizers or the internal tracks/buses without stopping the sequencer.Easily slice audio samples and insert notes to re-arrange the material.
 

Connectivity
Connect external midi-devices via the DIN input/output sockets on the back.Connect additional Midi-Controllers via the three USB 2.0 ports and configure them with a simple LUA scripting API.
 

The Piquencer Software - Focus on live playability
The sequencer is written in C++ and uses the JUCE library for audio processing to take advantage of the four CPU cores provided by the Raspberry Pi 3.
One eight-track sequencer on each side and a cross-fader allow combining different patterns and phrases in a playful manner.
The sequencing functions include chaining, automation, probability, step jumping, ratcheting (aka snareroll), note repeat, swing and accenting (accenting not yet implemented).
Setting different lenghts- and start points to tracks allows for easy creation of polyrhythms.
Audio-tracks are routed to one of four buses allowing to record separated stems (e.g. drums, bass, keys, fx) to the SD-card in WAV format.
Long WAV files (stems) can be loaded for disk-streaming and cue points added to pattern-tracks.
Notes are inserted either by live recording, toggling steps on a grid or surgical editing in the step-mode.
A visual help menu aids with memorizing key combinations.
Two global effects: Reverb and Delay (tempo synced). The sends are pre-fader.
Can use free open source Effect- and Instrument plug-ins (need to be natively compiled for the ARM7 processor) on instruments. (Assigning to buses and audio input to be implemented soon)
 

Dedicated music machine with the perks of a personal computer
It boots in about about 15 seconds when you turn it on. You do not need to use a mouse, the operating system is not bloated, you do not worry about drivers, OS updates or viruses like you might with a conventional laptop.
1 GB or RAM of which about 850 MB are usable for audio at runtime.
Use free open source Audio- and Instrument plug-ins (if natively compiled for ARM7 processor)
Long audio files can be streamed from disk.
Connect midi-controllers, mice & keyboards or storage devices via the three USB 2.0 sockets.
Transfer files via USB, Wifi or LAN. Simply backup your data with rsync.
The LUA scripting API allows defining custom input/output behavior for midi controllers such as controlling LEDs
Can be optionally powered with a regular micro-USB wall charger.
Buttons function as regular keyboard keys for entering names.
 

Use the Raspberry Pi like a regular PC When connected to an HDMI screen (optional)
Can be optionally configured to dual-boot into Raspian or other Linux dekstop distributions.
This allows to use additional music software such as VCV Rack, Tracktion, Reaper, Audacity, LMMS, Hydrogen and many more on the big screen. (Untested)
Or run office applications, play games, browse the internet etc.
 
Short Summary
I am IvoFX and I like to play and record electronic music. I am also a software developer.
The Jamberry Piquencer is an attempt to stop my Gear Acquisition Syndrome.
For a long time I was looking for a groove-box and purchased a bunch of them. None of them felt like they were sufficiently complete to be "the only one" I would need to serve as the "brain" of my set-up as there was always some feature I missed or some flaw which led me to go and buy another one hoping to fill the gap, leading to the infamous G.A.S. (gear acquisition syndrome) and spending more money.
I pondered about using the Raspberry Pi for music making for a while and when me and my wife moved from London back to Germany I decided to take three to four months off to devote myself to  writing the software and assembling the hardware needed for a standalone portable sequencer.
The Piquencer is my take on what I believe is a good work-flow and set of functionality tailored to my own needs as a user. I assume that it will work equally well for others.
 
What I Need & What You Get
The research and development is taking longer than expected, I am now in month seven. I need funding to continue developing the product for about two more months and get a reasonably polished prototype ready to show at the Musikmesse Frankfurt in the beginning of April to anyone interested in private.
My aim is to build the units by hand and sell them online myself for an estimated price of 300-350 Euros.
By donating, you will receive my dearest gratitude and help to increase the likelihood of the Piquencer becoming a real product - an affordable music box that is not a toy.
 
The Impact
An affordable music-box becomes available to the general public. Music gear tends to be very expensive.
I would love to be able to make a living off this product, selling the units and continuing to develop the software. I have many more ideas and plans for the future, such as allowing users to connect and jam online via wifi, as well as adding internal synthesizers and more effects.
 
Risks & Challenges
I have encountered and overcome many technical hurdles during development and I keep worrying that something might occur that would make it impossible to complete the project. It is looking good so far however.
 
 
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Spread the word!
 
 
Thank you,
IvoFX
 
I made some video recordings to show how patterns can be quickly created from scratch:

story:
DataLooper is complete and now shipping!

Please visit http://www.datalooperpedal.com for more info and to purchase!

The Only Foot Controller Built For Ableton Live Looping

Say goodbye to generic MIDI controllers that you have to spend days programming. Say goodbye to hardware loop pedals with limited inputs and inferior sound quality. The DataLooper takes the ergonomic design of a hardware loop pedal and pairs it with the power of software looping using Ableton Live. Using only a single USB cable, it gives you all the controls and visual feedback you need to use 3 loopers without ever having to look at the screen. 

 

DataLooper & Ableton vs. Hardware Loop Pedals

Using Ableton Live with a DataLooper pedal offers significant advantages over your traditional loop pedal. This system opens up a world of unlimited possibilities.

 

Featured By

In Use

Check out this video, featuring two DataLooper pedals synchronized via the Ableton Link protocol over WiFi. This demo showcases a combination of the Session Control mode and the Traditional Looper mode.

 

DataLooper UI

The DataLooper is designed to do everything your traditional loop pedal does and more. Every button is configurable, but this is the default setup:

 

Two Modes - Control the Looper or Session View

You can use DataLooper as a traditional loop pedal with the Ableton Looper plugin, or record ideas efficiently and quickly with clips in the Ableton Session View. Here’s an overview of both modes.

 

Looper Mode

Looper mode is designed to emulate a 3-track, traditional loop pedal. The software automatically detects tracks containing “DL#” in the track title and synchronizes the status LED’s with the looper, so you can loop without looking at a screen. The master control buttons on the right most column allow you to stop, mute or clear all three loops at once. 

Datalooper also features a 'new session' mode. If you hold the clear button for one second, the metronome will turn off and the tempo will re-calculate based on the next loop you record. This allows you to fluidly move between pieces without having to listen to a click track. Best of all, Datalooper never stops the transport to change tempo, meaning you can linearly record your whole set and capture every loop and overdub in pristine quality.

 

Session Control Mode

Session Control mode eliminates the need to MIDI map clip slots and gives you a hands-free workflow for rapidly creating clips on the fly. The software automatically detects tracks containing “CL#” in the track title and auto-scans for unused clip slots. The controls (record, stop, undo, clear) are then attached to that clip slot. When you are done with a clip, you can hold "stop" and advance to a new clip; allowing you to record a lot of ideas very quickly. Session control mode also allows you to work directly with MIDI Overdubs, meaning you can overdub onto MIDI clips without worrying about the session record button triggering every record armed track. 

 

Specs

DataLooper was designed to be large enough for comfortable button operation, but lightweight and small enough to fit on a pedalboard. It weighs less than 3 pounds and has the following dimensions:

Size L x W x H:

8.74 in x 5.75 in x 2.01 in
(222 mm x 146 mm x 51 mm)

 

Easy to Set Up

It's super easy to get started using the DataLooper. Simply install the included remote script and select DataLooper as a MIDI device in the Ableton preferences. Connect the micro-usb cable, open up your Ableton project and you're good to go!

 

A Deeper Technical Overview

If you want to fully understand all of the features of the DataLooper I would recommend watching this detailed overview to learn exactly how to set up and utilize the DataLooper to revolutionize your live or studio sessions.

 

Highly Configurable

Everybody has different requirements and needs for a foot controller. After using numerous MIDI keyboards, mixers and foot controllers, I realized that most of the programmers making the config software were simply out of touch with musicians. The DataLooper Config Software will allow you to decide exactly what data you'd like each button to send. The drag & drop interface allows you to drag in multiple types of MIDI messages or if you prefer, Ableton API functions! If you want to have the bottom right button turn the metronome on or off for instance, simply drag the Ableton metronome control function to the button and it will work without having to map each project.

 

Development & Technology

DataLooper was born in 2016 after trying to integrate loop pedals into a band environment and getting frustrated with the hassle of synchronization. The software has been tweaked and the pedals have been road tested and refined over a number of iterations.

DataLooper works by using the MIDI communication protocol with an ARM Cortex-M0+ based micro-controller. A custom Ableton Live Remote Script controls communication and synchronization between the DataLooper pedal and Ableton, making the DAW & pedal work seamlessly together.

Fulfillment Timeline

If the DataLooper is successfully funded, here's what the months following the Indiegogo campaign will look like.

November 20 - January 1: Final Prototype and Bench Testing

This period of time will allow for any final design changes based on community feedback and allow a final prototype to be created and fully tested.

January 2 - End of February : Manufacture & Software Tweaking

The first two months of 2019 will be dedicated to manufacturing the DataLoopers; assembling PCB's, coordinating with the machine shop to ensure perfect enclosures, etc. In tandem with the physical product development, the software aspect of the DataLooper will be fully tested and perfected.

Early March : Shipping and Website

At this point, DataLoopers should be ready to go and will be sent out to backers. To maintain communication with backers and other potential customers, a website with support, software downloads, etc. will be established for the DataLooper.

Why Support this Project? 

Your financial support will enable me to offer the DataLooper at a more accessible price point and get it into the hands of musicians immediately. Although a small batch (10) of the pedals has already been created, the manufacturing costs associated with small runs makes it cost prohibitive to offer these pedals at a reasonable price. Successful funding of the Indiegogo campaign will enable me to pay the manufacturing fees for a higher number of pedals to be created at once, lowering the cost per unit to a reasonable price point. It will also aid in covering additional costs, such as FCC Certification and Provisional Patent application fees required in bringing a product to market. By supporting this project, you are also supporting the development of an open-source looper system. All of the DataLooper software will be released under the GNU General Public License; this means that anyone can use and modify the software to customize it for their needs.

story:
Hi-Fidelity Wireless Audio

 

With AirMode you can convert your wired headphones into a great pair of wireless headphones. 

AirMode delivers all the same features that a premium wireless headphone can as well as giving you the ability to still use your current wired pair. 

Incorporating AAC, aptX and Bluetooth 4.1 wireless technology, our premium cables deliver the very best in portable HiFi sound whilst giving you full control over your music and calls from up to 10 metres away.

Additionally, AirMode features two hi-definition microphones that actively block out wind, traffic and other external noise, ensuring crystal clear phone calls and voice recognition commands even in the nosiest environments. 

 

 

Feature Overview

 

 

As Featured In

 

 

"At last, there is a stylish and affordable way to switch your wired headphones into a great pair of wireless headphones"

 

 

      “Airmode can give new life to wired headphones that otherwise might be left behind in the new wireless world”

 

​

 

“Packed with features and reasonably priced, AirMode could be the perfect Bluetooth dongle for retrofitting your gear for Apple’s wireless future”​​

 

 

“While a reason to buy new headphones is always fun, there are a few solutions with one of the coolest being AirMode, a cable that makes your headphones wireless”

​

“It will tune your music to be optimized, offer Siri and Google Now connectivity, enable users to make and receive calls, features Bluetooth, features NFC for easy pairing and much more”​​

 

​

 

"If you own a favorite pair of wired headphones that you would like to convert to support wireless connectivity. You may be interested in a new piece of hardware called AirMode that converts wired headphones to wireless"

 

The Future Is Wireless

 

 

The Design Concept

 

The AirMode Bluetooth cable concept originated from today's Bluetooth earphones where a cable feeds around the back of your neck. This ergonomic design is used by major earphone audio brands but none have offered this as a detachable, wireless cable for headphones as yet. Bluetooth earphones have a battery inside the earphone housings and the Bluetooth transmitter is placed inside the cables main controller. We have redesigned this concept and have managed to place all components inside the main controller which enables us to provide an all-in-one wireless solution for your detachable wired headphones and earphones. 

Please note, that this photo is not of AirMode. This is just used as a demonstration of the concept idea behind the AirMode Bluetooth cables. 

 

 

How Does AirMode Work?

 

The AirMode Bluetooth cable is available in three different versions and is designed to work with detachable, dual port headphones and earphones. This means that if your headphone has a single detachable cable that plugs into either the left or the right speaker chambers, it will work. It also works with headphones and earphones that have dual detachable cables that feed into both the left and right speaker chambers at the same time. 

 

 

 

AirMode Usability

 

The AirMode Bluetooth cables are small, lightweight, water and sweat resistant. Combined with our HD noise blocking microphones and voice recognition feature, they are ideal for the office, factory, gym, running, gaming, watching movies, mixing or commuting.

 

 

Hi-Fidelity Sound

 

AirMode has incorporated aptX and AAC high-performance stereo codecs. AptX is suitable for Android and other devices, whereas AAC is suitable for IOS devices (Apple). AAC and aptX audio technology delivers CD / Hi-Fi sound quality (16-bit/44.1kHz) over Bluetooth connections.

AptX is featured in over 320 leading audio brands from headphones, speakers, smartphones, gaming consoles and home entertainment products. We have used the latest aptX - CSR8645 chip due to its upgraded features and its headphone stereo separation capabilities. Stereo separation means that the AirMode Bluetooth cables can help to recreate audio recordings in its most natural state, by delivering clear and accurate sound similar to a 3D audio experience.

To give you a clearer understanding of Stereo Separation we've highlighted a link for you to read - http://www.ehow.com/info_12129970_stereo-separa...

 

AirMode Full Spec

 

Wireless

  • Bluetooth® 4.1
  • Leading aptX® codec for high-quality audio
  • AAC-LC, MP3 and SBC decoders
  • NFC easy pairing mode
  • 10 meter operating range
  • Multi device compatible 

Audio 

  • 20Hz-20kHz Frequency respnse 
  • Hi-Fidelity 16-bit/44.1kHz Audio
  • CVC HD audio enhancements
  • Headphone stereo separation (soft 3D)

Battery 

  • iOS Battery status monitor
  • 200 Hour standby time
  • 6 Hours of playtime
  • 2 Hour charge time
  • Li-Po 100 mAh battery

Features

  • Volume and track control
  • Voice prompts
  • Siri and Google Now enabled
  • Make and receive calls
  • Dual HD microphones with ANC  
  • IPX5 water and sweat resistant

Materials

  • Durable braided fabric cable
  • PC+ABS
  • Gold plated audio connectors
  • Aluminium 

Weight and Dimensions 

  • 48.20 mm x 10.80 mm x 14.20 mm 
  • 12 Grams

 

 

In The Box 

 

Each AirMode Bluetooth cable comes with a pocket-sized hard case and a USB charging cable.

 

 

Which Brands Are Compatible? 

 

We've listed several of the major brands that the AirMode Bluetooth cables are compatible with. If your headphone brand is not listed but suits the above criteria, please contact us to clarify. 

Please note, that Audio Nation has no affiliation with the below brands and all trademarks and related content are owned by their respective companies.

 

 

Which Devices Are Compatible? 

 

AirMode works with all Bluetooth enabled smartphones, music players, tablets, computers, mixers and gaming consoles.

 

Which Headphones Are Compatible?

 

We have listed several of the top selling headphones and earphones which are compatible with each AirMode cable. If your headphones or earphones are not listed and suit the above criteria, please contact us to clarify. 

 

AirMode 3.5

 

 

V-MODA - M-100, M-80 and XS

Monster - DNA, TUNES HD, 24K, INSPIRATION, ADIDAS, ROC and N TUNES

Master & Dynamic - MH30 and MH40

Beats - PRO, DETOX and MIXR

Bang & Olufsen - H6

KOSS - Pro4s

PSB Speakers - M4U 1 and M4U 2

NAD - HP50 

Jabra - Vega

AIAIAI - TMA-2

Ultrasone - PRO 900, PRO 2900 and PRO 750

Marshall Headphones - Monitor and Major 2

Skullcandy - Mix Master

Urbanears - Plattan and Plattan ADV

SMS Audio - DJ Pro

Plugged - Crown

 

AirMode 2.5

 

 

Sol Republic - TRACKS, TRACKS HD, MASTER TRACKS, X3, V8, V10 and V12

LSTN - TROUBADOURS, FILLMORE and ENCORE

Meze - 55 CLASSIC, 73 CLASSIC and 88 CLASSIC 

Sennheiser - D700, HD477, HD497, HD212 Pro, EH250 and EH350

Symphonized - WRAITH and WRAITH 2.0

AudioQuest - NIGHTHAWK

OPPO - PM1 and PM2

Hifiman - HE400, HE560 and HE1000

Beyerdynamic -  T1, T5p and AMIRON HOME

Pryma - IO

 

AirMode MMCX 

 

 

Westone - W10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 80, UM PRO 10, 20, 30, 50 and ALPH ADVENTURE

Campfire Audio - JUPITER, NOVA and ANDROMEDA

Onkyo - ES-CTI300, ES-HF300, ES-FC300, 

Onkyo - IE-HF300, IE-FC300, IE-CTI300s, E900M

Ultrasone - EDITION 5, EDITION 8, EDITION M

Ultrasone - IQ

Shure - SE215, 315, 425, 535, 846

Pioneer - DJE-1500 and DJE-2000

Dunu - TITAN 3 and TITAN 5

Sony - N3AP and N1AP

AKG - N40

JVC Kenwood - FX-850

Ultimate Ears - UE 900s

 

 

Additional Perk

 

 

If the AirMode Bluetooth cable is not compatible with your current pair of headphones, we'd like to offer you the opportunity to purchase a pair of our awesome Bloc & Roc headphones. By purchasing a pair, it will help us bring the AirMode Bluetooth cables to the market and by way of saying thanks, we're offering 60% discount per headphone. 

 

Headphone Overview 

 

Each headphone is crafted from aerospace-grade aluminium, steel, memory foam and supple materials, to provide ultimate strength, comfort and durability. The customised 40mm dynamic drivers have been enhanced to deliver a powerful, yet highly defined audio experience. Each aluminium speaker chamber has been hand-prepared then anodised in a deep matte finish. Designed for everyday use, the universal one button remote and in-line mic gives you control over your music and incoming calls. Each headphone has been hand-built and individually sound tested by our engineers in Britain.

 

Bloc & Roc Headphone Reviews 

 

 

Available Headphones

 

 

 

For more information on Bloc & Roc please visit our website - www.blocandroc.com

 

 

AirMode Hi-Res Photos

 

Press and hi-res photos can be downloaded here - http://int.audionation.uk/

 

AirMode Prototype In The Making

 

 

AirMode Production Timeline

 

  • FEBRUARY 2016  -  IDEA CREATED
  • MARCH 2016  -  CONCEPT FINALISED
  • JULY 2016  -  FIRST PROTOTYPES
  • SEPTEMBER 2016  -  FINAL PROTOTYPES
  • NOVEMBER 2016  -  LAUNCH CROWDFUNDING
  • DECEMBER 2016  -  COMMISSION MOULDS
  • JANUARY 2017  -  ASSEMBLE PRODUCTS
  • MARCH 2017  -  SHIP FIRST ORDERS

 

Risks And Challenges

 

We have tested the AirMode Bluetooth cables for durability and sound performance in several different scenarios and are pleased with the end result. We have ensured that all parts are made from high-grade materials and our chosen software is used by millions of people throughout the world.

Quality Control:

Our choosen supplier is ISO9001: 2000 certified which ensures the highest possible standard of quality and consistency throughout all their manufacturing processes. They have been manufacturing high-end Bluetooth speakers and accessories for over 10 years. 

Unexpected issues:

We have done our best to plan for every possible eventuality but obviously unexpected issues can arise. We will keep our backers informed at all times should this happen. 

Warranty:

All AirMode Bluetooth cables come with a one year limited warranty. If your product is faulty upon delivery, we will replace it free of charge. If AirMode does not work with your dual port headphones or earphones, we will refund you the full balance. Our warranty does not cover accidental damage. 

Deliveries:

We will be using a traceable delivery service with insurance for all perks. Delivery times will vary from a couple of days to a week or so depending on your location in the world. Once your order is shipped, we will issue you with your tracking details. Import costs will be the responsibility of the backer to pay upon receiving goods.

Customer Service:

With over 2 years experience in distribution, retail and consumer sales, we know how important customer service is. A member of our team will be available 5 days a week for any questions or issues with our products. Please note that our time zone is GMT and we are open from 9am to 5:30pm Monday to Friday. 

 

Thank you for your time and support.

 

Long live your headphones!
story_txt:

This ergonomic design is used by major earphone audio brands but none have offered this as a detachable, wireless cable for headphones as yet. Bluetooth earphones have a battery inside the earphone housings and the Bluetooth transmitter is placed inside the cables main controller. We have redesigned this concept and have managed to place all components inside the main controller which enables us to provide an all-in-one wireless solution for your detachable wired headphones and earphones. Please note, that this photo is not of AirMode. This is just used as a demonstration of the concept idea behind the AirMode Bluetooth cables.   How Does AirMode Work? The AirMode Bluetooth cable is available in three different versions and is designed to work with detachable, dual port headphones and earphones. This means that if your headphone has a single detachable cable that plugs into either the left or the right speaker chambers, it will work. It also works with headphones and earphones that have dual detachable cables that feed into both the left and right speaker chambers at the same time.  


 
 
AirMode Usability
 
The AirMode Bluetooth cables are small, lightweight, water and sweat resistant. Combined with our HD noise blocking microphones and voice recognition feature, they are ideal for the office, factory, gym, running, gaming, watching movies, mixing or commuting.
 

 
Hi-Fidelity Sound
 
AirMode has incorporated aptX and AAC high-performance stereo codecs. AptX is suitable for Android and other devices, whereas AAC is suitable for IOS devices (Apple). AAC and aptX audio technology delivers CD / Hi-Fi sound quality (16-bit/44.1kHz) over Bluetooth connections.
AptX is featured in over 320 leading audio brands from headphones, speakers, smartphones, gaming consoles and home entertainment products. We have used the latest aptX - CSR8645 chip due to its upgraded features and its headphone stereo separation capabilities. Stereo separation means that the AirMode Bluetooth cables can help to recreate audio recordings in its most natural state, by delivering clear and accurate sound similar to a 3D audio experience.
To give you a clearer understanding of Stereo Separation we've highlighted a link for you to read - http://www.ehow.com/info_12129970_stereo-separa...
 
AirMode Full Spec
 
Wireless

Bluetooth® 4.1
Leading aptX® codec for high-quality audio
AAC-LC, MP3 and SBC decoders
NFC easy pairing mode
10 meter operating range
Multi device compatible 

Audio 

20Hz-20kHz Frequency respnse 
Hi-Fidelity 16-bit/44.1kHz Audio
CVC HD audio enhancements
Headphone stereo separation (soft 3D)

Battery 

iOS Battery status monitor
200 Hour standby time
6 Hours of playtime
2 Hour charge time
Li-Po 100 mAh battery

Features

Volume and track control
Voice prompts
Siri and Google Now enabled
Make and receive calls
Dual HD microphones with ANC  
IPX5 water and sweat resistant

Materials

Durable braided fabric cable
PC+ABS
Gold plated audio connectors
Aluminium 

Weight and Dimensions 

48.20 mm x 10.80 mm x 14.20 mm 
12 Grams

 

 
In The Box 
 
Each AirMode Bluetooth cable comes with a pocket-sized hard case and a USB charging cable.



 
 
Which Brands Are Compatible? 
 
We've listed several of the major brands that the AirMode Bluetooth cables are compatible with. If your headphone brand is not listed but suits the above criteria, please contact us to clarify. Please note, that Audio Nation has no affiliation with the below brands and all trademarks and related content are owned by their respective companies.  Which Devices Are Compatible?  AirMode works with all Bluetooth enabled smartphones, music players, tablets, computers, mixers and gaming consoles. Which Headphones Are Compatible? We have listed several of the top selling headphones and earphones which are compatible with each AirMode cable. If your headphones or earphones are not listed and suit the above criteria, please contact us to clarify.  AirMode 3.5  V-MODA - M-100, M-80 and XSMonster - DNA, TUNES HD, 24K, INSPIRATION, ADIDAS, ROC and N TUNESMaster & Dynamic - MH30 and MH40Beats - PRO, DETOX and MIXRBang & Olufsen - H6KOSS - Pro4sPSB Speakers - M4U 1 and M4U 2NAD - HP50 Jabra - VegaAIAIAI - TMA-2Ultrasone - PRO 900, PRO 2900 and PRO 750Marshall Headphones - Monitor and Major 2Skullcandy - Mix MasterUrbanears - Plattan and Plattan ADVSMS Audio - DJ ProPlugged - Crown AirMode 2.5  Sol Republic - TRACKS, TRACKS HD, MASTER TRACKS, X3, V8, V10 and V12LSTN - TROUBADOURS, FILLMORE and ENCOREMeze - 55 CLASSIC, 73 CLASSIC and 88 CLASSIC Sennheiser - D700, HD477, HD497, HD212 Pro, EH250 and EH350Symphonized - WRAITH and WRAITH 2.0AudioQuest - NIGHTHAWKOPPO - PM1 and PM2Hifiman - HE400, HE560 and HE1000Beyerdynamic -  T1, T5p and AMIRON HOMEPryma - IO AirMode MMCX   Westone - W10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 80, UM PRO 10, 20, 30, 50 and ALPH ADVENTURECampfire Audio - JUPITER, NOVA and ANDROMEDAOnkyo - ES-CTI300, ES-HF300, ES-FC300, Onkyo - IE-HF300, IE-FC300, IE-CTI300s, E900MUltrasone - EDITION 5, EDITION 8, EDITION MUltrasone - IQShure - SE215, 315, 425, 535, 846Pioneer - DJE-1500 and DJE-2000Dunu - TITAN 3 and TITAN 5Sony - N3AP and N1APAKG - N40JVC Kenwood - FX-850Ultimate Ears - UE 900s  Additional Perk  If the AirMode Bluetooth cable is not compatible with your current pair of headphones, we'd like to offer you the opportunity to purchase a pair of our awesome Bloc & Roc headphones. By purchasing a pair, it will help us bring the AirMode Bluetooth cables to the market and by way of saying thanks, we're offering 60% discount per headphone.  Headphone Overview  Each headphone is crafted from aerospace-grade aluminium, steel, memory foam and supple materials, to provide ultimate strength, comfort and durability. The customised 40mm dynamic drivers have been enhanced to deliver a powerful, yet highly defined audio experience. Each aluminium speaker chamber has been hand-prepared then anodised in a deep matte finish. Designed for everyday use, the universal one button remote and in-line mic gives you control over your music and incoming calls. Each headphone has been hand-built and individually sound tested by our engineers in Britain. Bloc & Roc Headphone Reviews   Available Headphones   For more information on Bloc & Roc please visit our website - www.blocandroc.com  AirMode Hi-Res Photos Press and hi-res photos can be downloaded here - http://int.audionation.uk/ AirMode Prototype In The Making  AirMode Production Timeline 

FEBRUARY 2016  -  IDEA CREATED

MARCH 2016  -  CONCEPT FINALISED

JULY 2016  -  FIRST PROTOTYPES

SEPTEMBER 2016  -  FINAL PROTOTYPES

NOVEMBER 2016  -  LAUNCH CROWDFUNDING

DECEMBER 2016  -  COMMISSION MOULDS

JANUARY 2017  -  ASSEMBLE PRODUCTS

MARCH 2017  -  SHIP FIRST ORDERS
 Risks And Challenges We have tested the AirMode Bluetooth cables for durability and sound performance in several different scenarios and are pleased with the end result. We have ensured that all parts are made from high-grade materials and our chosen software is used by millions of people throughout the world.Quality Control:Our choosen supplier is ISO9001: 2000 certified which ensures the highest possible standard of quality and consistency throughout all their manufacturing processes. They have been manufacturing high-end Bluetooth speakers and accessories for over 10 years. Unexpected issues:We have done our best to plan for every possible eventuality but obviously unexpected issues can arise. We will keep our backers informed at all times should this happen. Warranty:All AirMode Bluetooth cables come with a one year limited warranty. If your product is faulty upon delivery, we will replace it free of charge. If AirMode does not work with your dual port headphones or earphones, we will refund you the full balance. Our warranty does not cover accidental damage. Deliveries:We will be using a traceable delivery service with insurance for all perks. Delivery times will vary from a couple of days to a week or so depending on your location in the world. Once your order is shipped, we will issue you with your tracking details. Import costs will be the responsibility of the backer to pay upon receiving goods.Customer Service:With over 2 years experience in distribution, retail and consumer sales, we know how important customer service is. A member of our team will be available 5 days a week for any questions or issues with our products. Please note that our time zone is GMT and we are open from 9am to 5:30pm Monday to Friday.  Thank you for your time and support. Long live your headphones!

story:
A home for Schwebung Mastering

My name is Stephan Mathieu, some of you will be familiar with my work in the field of electroacoustic music. Since the early 1990s I have released 60 albums either solo or in collaboration with likeminded people, among them Taylor Deupree, Fennesz, Robert Hampson (as MAIN), Kassel Jaeger, France Jobin, Akira Rabelais and many others. You can read more about my background and approach to sound and mastering here. 

I want to shift my focus from creating towards mastering music for other artists, a work I deeply love and that in the longer run will allow me and my family more financial stability. 

To archieve this goal I want to start building my own mastering studio in September 2018.

 

Mastering is the last creative step before music gets released on vinyl, CD, cassette, or as files for digital distribution and streaming. During the mastering process, a production will see the final adjustments needed to ensure it will sound great on a wide range of speakers and headphones. Depending on the quality of the delivered mix, interventions necessary to archive this goal can either be subtle or rather drastic. 99% of professional or semi-professional productions made today will benefit greatly from careful mastering, a release that wants to stand out sonically can't do without this crucial finish.

While sometimes referred to as a black art, in reality mastering is nothing but a process based on a strong set of technical skills, knowledge, a deep dedication to sound, and carefully selected equipment set up in a perfectly tuned listening environment.

Excellent mastering can't be archieved without any of these.

Skills can be appropriated through years of hands-on experience and research, dedication has to be within you, cutting-edge equipment and a great sounding room for critical listening requires a substantial budget.

 

The current state of my project

During a test phase, launched in 2015 I have worked on 200+ masters for some outstanding artists and labels from around the world. While many of them come from a similar musical area to my own, I have also worked with musicians and labels covering the whole range – from jazz, pop, indie, metal, house, contemporary and minimal music, to a series of Mozart Piano Concertos and Bartok String Quartets.

 

The piece by Jefre Cantu-Ledesma in the video above is a fine example of what I believe in when it comes to good mastering: music will sound fantastic when it is treated carefully, no matter whether it’s a bells-and-whistles pro-studio production, a deliberately lo-fi wash of noise recorded at home, or anything in between. Jefre’s album 'A Year with 13 Moons' – which made many best-of-year lists in 2015 – is a “true” high-resolution master with a full dynamic range and a frequency spectrum extending 35 kHz. It delivers its essence through earbuds playing on Vimeo, just as it will make your jaw drop when played on the very best set of loudspeakers.

 

Most of my mastering work so far was done as a guest in professional studios run by friends, which offered me a very good working environment and great tools. However, this was not entirely effective simply because I had to collect some bookings first, find a free studio time slot, and then travel either 80 or even 250 kilometers to get there. Regardless of this, while focusing on mastering regularly it became clear to me that this is what I wanted to do for a living, and that I need my own studio to do this on a professional level. 

 

In 2017 I prepared a fully-fledged business plan which was thoroughly checked and approved by the county's office for economic development, I also found a bank that was convinced by my endeavour and willing to apply for a state-funded low-interest founding loan in my name. Since I never had a fixed income from my work as an independent artist and teacher, I will now have to present a minimum of 10% in equity – € 12,500 Euro – in order to have this loan approved.

 

What do I need the funds for?

For my studio I want to build a room with highly linear acoustics and acquire a rather minimal, yet high-end selection of mastering-grade digital and analog equipment that will allow me to execute my work on the highest professional level. My choice of tools is based on 25 years of hands-on experience in professional studios around the world, I know what I need in order to work effectively for many years to come and, just as important: what I don't need.

The total investment I want to make in order to get my studio up and running is € 125,000 Euro. A financial buffer to cover all running costs during the construction stage and seed phase is included with this budget.

 

With this campaign I'm looking to collect € 18,000 Euro:

  • € 12,500 Euro – the equivalent of 10% of my studio loan
  • € 4,000 Euro to cover the remaining manufacturing costs for the items offered here
  • € 1,500 Euro to cover the campaign fees and extras

 

If you want to support my project you can choose from a range of perks, most of them being exclusive to this campaign.

 

A note regarding the flexible funding goal

While I'm certainly planning to reach my funding goal of € 18,000 Euro, I've decided to keep it flexible, which means that I will receive the final amount collected, no matter whether or not the goal is met. However, the initial feedback received from subscribers to my mailing list has been quite overwhelming.

I will get the new CD releases offered here to the manufacturers as long as I've collected a minimum of € 5,000 Euro to cover costs. The items will be ready to ship around September 24th.

The mastering offers described below will of course be honored either way. 

If the campaign turns out to be a success, I may add a stretch goal for another special item. The more equity I can build up for my studio, the easier I can start this new chapter in my life!

 

So, what will you get?

 

In return, music

For the listeners among you, I’d like to offer a selection of three releases from my Schwebung label, two of them exclusive to this campaign.

As a musician, band or label, you can book a session to have your next release mastered by me at a very special rate

or have one of your tracks remixed by Rafael Anton Irisarri of The Sight Below and Black Knoll Studio.

Please see below for further information on these alternatives. 


 

1 – CD Releases

Please note that there are some variations for bundled items which  include the actual shipping costs, some of them at a discounted price. The new releases are currently in production and will be manufactured once the campaign has finished on August 28th. They will be ready to be shipped to you within 4 to 5 weeks.

 

↳ A special 2CD compilation

 

SCALE is a new 2CD collection of 11 pieces given to me by some friends and colleagues in support of my project:

Akira Rabelais, Catherine Christer Hennix, Crys Cole and Oren Ambarchi, France Jobin, Francois Bonnet, Jim O'Rourke, Leyland Kirby, Motion Graphics, Stephen O'Malley, Thomas Brinkmann, Toshimaru Nakamura /Will Long /Stephan Mathieu

 

Apart from François’ track, which I was allowed to pick from one of his digital releases, all of them are unpublished material, most of them made especially for this occasion.

The tracks were compiled and mastered by me and it's safe to say that I'm extremely proud of this one.

 

  • 11 tracks / 120 minutes duration
  • 2 CDs in a PANTONE printed 6-panel gatefold sleeve
  • Each copy comes with a unique inlay card
  • Designed by Caro Mikalef for Cabina.

 

For this release I'll have as many copies made as there are orders. No repress, no digital version, this compilation is exclusively available during this campaign. If you want a copy, order it now.

SCALE ships on or around September 24th.

 

 

↳ A new 8CD box set from my Schwebung label 

 

The FOLIO 8 CD Box collects my 5 original releases on Schwebung which were not previously available on CD. Six PANTONE printed 6-panel gatefold sleeves housed in a custom-made box to give plenty of space for Caro Mikalef's original design:

 

  1. FOLIO is the unpublished instrumental version of the first Schwebung release Palimpsest with Sylvain Chauveau, available for the first time
  2. THE FALLING ROCKET was released as a 2LP on the Dekorder label and comes here with an additional unreleased track of 20 minutes duration 
  3. SACRED GROUND is the original soundtrack to the award-winning documentary film of the same title, released as a digital edition in 2014
  4. NACHTSTÜCKE is a reworked version of the 2015 digital edition, 3 CDs in 2 gatefold sleeves
  5. BEFORE NOSTROMO is my homage to Ridley Scott’s 1979 classic Alien, released as a digital edition in 2015

 

  • 5 albums / 450 minute duration
  • PANTONE printed custom made slipcase
  • 8 CDs in six PANTONE printed 6-panel gatefold sleeves
  • Designed by Caro Mikalef
  • Remastered for CD in 2018
  • Includes a download through Bandcamp, sent to you on September 06th

 

Edition of 250, first 100 are numbered, no repress.

FOLIO ships on or around September 24th.

 

↳ RADIANCE 12CD box set 

 

_RADIANCE is now sold out and so are the CD packages containing this box set_

RADIANCE is a 12CD box set with new works by Stephan Mathieu

 

  • 12 CDs in PANTONE printed 4-panel gatefold sleeves
  • Custom-made slipcase
  • 42*50cm fold-out print
  • Designed by Caro Mikalef
  • Includes an instant download through Bandcamp

 

This box set will ship immediately once the campaign has reached € 5,000 Euro

 

2 – Mastering special

 

Am I talking to the musicians/producers/gearheads now? Let's go.

First of all, you will find plenty of information on what I offer, what I need from you, my approach and the studio I want to build at schwebung-mastering.com. In case you have a question or request, write me an email anytime.

 

Plug-ins became really good in the last couple of years and I'm using a handful of fine tools I would never want to be without. Some of my colleagues are doing a fantastic job working exclusively in-the-box, all of them in acoustically tuned studios with a great set of monitors. However, for me it's the mix of excellent digital tools and the magic of analog transformers and valves that keep me excited. A digital piano or drum kit can sound really great but it will never come close to the character and detail the real thing has, not even the very best of them.  I'm currently working by travelling with my own DAC to two different all-analog studios equipped with some fabulous vintage gear. As mentioned earlier, this was always meant as a testing phase for various reasons.

My own mastering chain will have one of the best mastering DACs available, my long-time dream set of monitors, and an all-analog chain custom-built for me by legendary equipment maker Jonte Knif. Even though there is a wide range of new and vintage analog mastering gear available, it made sense for me to take this "custom everything from one source" approach, just as you would find in the classic studios from the 1950s and 60s. That being said, I'm not interested in a vintage sounding studio, quite the opposite – I care very much about the advantages of cutting-edge digital technology. Each project has to have its own sound signature, the one that will enhance your vision perfectly. In the end, mastering has to be all about the result, not the tools or the process.

 

What’s on offer during this campaign?

Basically, a complete mastering package for all the formats you'll need to get your music released at a very special price:

 

  • Vinyl / CD / Cassette / Download / Streaming – any combination of these
  • Mastered for iTunes – I'm certified by Apple
  • A DDP.2.0 image if your release will go on a CD
  • I'm working with some of the best cutting engineers and manufacturers around in case you will need help with this

 

In case you're interested in one of the variations, let me know when you want to book a date. Until the end of October I will continue to work in external studios, from November on we can also work in an attended session in my new studio in Bonn, Germany. Booking dates are first come/first served.

 

¶

Thanks for your interest in my work, let's make this happen!

 

Stephan Mathieu

Schwebung-Mastering.com / mail@schwebung.com

 

¶

As mentioned earlier, this was always meant as a testing phase for various reasons.
My own mastering chain will have one of the best mastering DACs available, my long-time dream set of monitors, and an all-analog chain custom-built for me by legendary equipment maker Jonte Knif. Even though there is a wide range of new and vintage analog mastering gear available, it made sense for me to take this "custom everything from one source" approach, just as you would find in the classic studios from the 1950s and 60s. That being said, I'm not interested in a vintage sounding studio, quite the opposite – I care very much about the advantages of cutting-edge digital technology. Each project has to have its own sound signature, the one that will enhance your vision perfectly. In the end, mastering has to be all about the result, not the tools or the process.
 
What’s on offer during this campaign?
Basically, a complete mastering package for all the formats you'll need to get your music released at a very special price:
 

Vinyl / CD / Cassette / Download / Streaming – any combination of these
Mastered for iTunes – I'm certified by Apple
A DDP.2.0 image if your release will go on a CD
I'm working with some of the best cutting engineers and manufacturers around in case you will need help with this

 
In case you're interested in one of the variations, let me know when you want to book a date. Until the end of October I will continue to work in external studios, from November on we can also work in an attended session in my new studio in Bonn, Germany. Booking dates are first come/first served.
 
¶
Thanks for your interest in my work, let's make this happen!
 
Stephan Mathieu
Schwebung-Mastering.com / mail@schwebung.com
 
¶

story:
Free Gift Event !!

For All Sound-vessel backers, we decided to provide special cable.
It can divide L, R sound with cable connection.
Some users may like it more than wireless connection !
3.5mm male stereo to 3.5 mm L/R female mono splitter cable
These cables can not be found easily on market yet !

 

This is the Sound-vessel.

The most perfect Home Audio speaker
with Bone shaking bass and
Unlimited extension function

Introducing a most innovative wireless speaker designed to be perfect audio speaker of your musical universe. The Sound-vessel is a high tech marvel that allows you to enjoy all of your music throughout your home and beyond, with amazing sonic realism and unique function, The Sound-vessel has amazing functions like twins stereo pairing and double-Aux clone. so that it allows everyone to enjoy 3D Hi-Fidelity sound with smooth highs, crystal clear mid-range and bone shaking bass.
Sound-vessel, It's different!

 

Bring a universe of Real Stereo music
into every part of your life

24bit/192kHz aptX and ACC Hi-Fidelity powered by CSR 4.2 Chipset.
Balanced sound and Bone shaking bass : 2x32mm Tweeters, 1x70mm Woofer and 1x64mm Sub Woofer
Unlimited extension sound system : Bluetooth Twins and Double AUX Clone network function
Unique function : Shuffle Play of Micro SD, Power Bank, Hans-Free, Carrying Strap, 1/4 Tripod compatible
 

 

Feel the real 3D stereo sound
with Sound-vessel

There is no lack of speakers that sound “good for their size.” A very few even have impressive bass. But they all sound like what they are monophonic sound (like AM radio), even though they note that having over 2.0 channel inside. Most one speakers fail to create the illusion that there are live musicians in the room; the sound is flat and one-dimensional.

The Sound-vessel of stereo network technology produces a huge multi-dimensional sound image that’s like listening high-end home theater speakers. Everyone who has heard the Sound-vessel has shaken his or her head in amazement. “I can’t believe that twins Sound-vessel sound like very expensive high-end home audio speakers!"

 

Easy home audio network extension

No need to install and operate app! Just enjoy with 2 extension functions. Twins Stereo Pairing and Double Aux Clone!

 
  • Bluetooth Twins Stereo Pairing / with 2 Sound-vessel speakers

  • Unlimited Sound Clone via AUX IN/OUT / with Sound-vessel and other speaker

See the Sound
Sound-vessel

How to make balanced sound and bone-shaking bass effect? LET US SEE THE SOUND.

  • 24bit/192kHz aptX and ACC Hi-Fidelity sound CSR 4.2 Bluetooth Chipset
  • 2 X 32mm TWEETERS / High

  • 1 X 70mm SUPERSIZE WOOFER / mid/bass

  • 1 X 65mm SUB WOOFER / more for bass

 

USER FRIENDLY
INTUITIVE INTERFACE

Sound-vessel has intuitive interface and unique functions. Compare with your speakers in your home. It's different!

  • Touch / Play, Forward, Backward, Micro SD Shuffle Control
  • Tactile / Power, Battery, Bluetooth Pairing Control

  • Metal Wheel / Volume Control
  • Tripod Mound / 1/4 standard camera mount Tripod compatible

  • Carrying Strap / Easy grip and movement

  • PLAY BLUETOOTH : CSR 4.2 / Bluetooth ID : D036191)

  • PLAY AUX : 3.5mm AUX cable input
  • PLAY MICRO SD WITH SHUFFLE BUTTON : Random Play Hot Key

" Techs Specs "

  • SIZE/WEIGHT: 110 x 110 x 165mm (WxDxH) / 950g
  • MATERIAL: ABS, PC, metal, fabric
  • SPEAKERS: 4 speaker units
  • CONNECT:Bluetooth, AUX, Micro-SD
  • POWER: Rechargeable built-in battery (LG 3200mAh x 2ea)
  • PMPO: 200 Watts
  • Charging time : 5V 1.0~1.2A(Max) / 5~6 hours
  • PLAYING TIME:  10~12 hours (middle volume)

                                                                                                                            

 

ANYWHERE FOR YOUR LIFESTYLE

Sound-vessel can be your partner for your all lifestyle. you can see where sound-vessel goes with you. Home, office, camping, outdoor and everywhere with you.

  • HOME AUDIO

  • OUTDOOR / CAMPING / TRAVEL

 

REWARDS

 

TIMELINE

 

Production stage

We've already finished the Product development and validation process. and just started production stage. 

 

About us

There are plenty of hardware products available on the market, new or old, cheap or expensive, simple or complicated. However, It is hard to find new marvels to meet users needs correctly.

In case of audio products, sound and design are first requirements for new product. and more we've focused to expand cases to be able to use our product. so that we could develop Sound-vessel speaker can be extended without limit. Twins stereo pairing and Double AUX clone functions are the key! 

Sound-vessel is the first project that designed and engineered by Fundian, most innovative hardware team in the world.

Now you can meet this Sound-vessel at Indiegogo.

 

How to help us if you don't buy Sound-vessel ?

If you can't afford to contribute to our campaign, if you already own a speaker you love, or if you're waiting for us to be in physical shops to buy our Sound-vessel, it doesn't mean you can't help us !

Please share, comment, like and spread the good work !

Find us here and share the word ! You may use the indiegogo share tools!

  • Facebook
  • Instagram
  • Pinterest
  • LinkedIn

Thanks for your interest, we are very proud and impatient to send you the best of our products.
We believe you'll soon become our fans like us ;-)

story:
Have you ever held 440watts of power driving two huge 10” woofers in your hands? Well its finally here. The BumpBoxx "FreeStyle" Bluetooth Boombox. We are shooting you straight back to 1983 with this “Nostalgic”  mixed with a modern technological twist. Get your very own BumpBoxx and be the king of your block.

 

We are Bumpboxx Europe BV, a team of motivated audiophiles from all over the world!  We've been a part of the Bumpboxx movement since it's inception in North America back in 2016 and are so EXCITED to finally bring this product back home, to EUROPE.  Since day ONE, our mission has always been to provide the most extreme SOUND and BASS, while maintaining that NOSTALGIC look.  Come find out why fans have announced Bumpboxx as the LOUDEST boom box on the planet.

 
 

The FreeStyle S.E. (Second Generation 2017) T-Pain's Review

 

The Freestyle V3S (Third Generation *2018*)

Bumpboxxes most popular model has been the "FreeStyle" line.  Two years of tinkering, trial and error and listening to our fans, and we are now on our third Generation called the "V3S".  With all the growing pains behind us, this couldn't be a better time to enter the Europe market!
 

 

 

Designed In California, the Freestyle V3S comes in multiple colors to choose from.

 

LLCOOLJ rocking his custom V3S

 

 

A lot of you have been patiently awaiting (Okay maybe not patiently) for us to come to Europe so we want to show our appreciation for your support!

 

Your contribution

Your contribution to our campaign will be vital in helping us have a quick turn around in inventory.  Bumpboxx currently has three more models that we'd love to also introduce to the European marketplace.  With your help, we can order more inventory and continue to grow the Bumpboxx movement here in Europe!

 

San Francisco Forty-Niners getting PUMPED pregame with their Bumpboxx!

 

Check out our USA Fans!

Bumpboxx USA has had amazing success in North America.  Fortune 500 companies, celebrities and major sports franchises have already joined the Bumpboxx movement.  Take a peak at their social media page to see what fans already think of their Bumpboxx!

www.facebook.com/Bumpboxx

https://www.instagram.com/bumpboxx/?hl=en

 

James Harden of (NBA) Houston Rockets - 2018 M.V.P.

 

Shout out to launchingforecharity

 

 

 

Win your own FREE FreeStyle V3S!

We understand some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't have your own!  Follow our facebook & Instagram pages and learnhow you can enter to WIN a Bumpboxx!

www.facebook.com/bumpboxxeu

https://www.instagram.com/bumpboxxeurope

 

 

 

 

Our biggest challenge has been keeping up with the overwhelming support we've received from our International fans. Our product shipment is already on its way to Europe! We are excited to ship our FreeStyle V3S' before end of October.

 

 

Limited INDIEGOGO Campaign Supply!

PREORDER TODAY!!

 

 

 Shout out to MC Lil Dee IG: lildee_raps

 
 
Shout out to Kate Delos Santos IG: katedelossantos
