story:
Hi Guys. We are Yannick and Erik — BLOMM & BERGER.

We designed and developed a high quality, bluetooth headphone. We set our focus on sound quality and functionality to make something special for the community. That is why we chose to work with high quality material and a few essential functions which are explained below.

Why did we create this product? 

We wanted to create a lifestyle product which benefits from a great sound system and a list of functions which improve sound experience. One of the functions is the smart on/off function, which allows you to pause and get right back to the music. It was also our goal to create a headphone which can be adjusted to any situation so music can be enjoyed through on-ear and around-ear earpads. A lot of people buy on-ear headphones because they are not so big, will then although miss the great sound around-ear earpads achieve. So why not have both?













SMART ON/OFF FUNCTION - MUSIC PAUSES AUTOMATICALLY

This function allows you to take off the headphone in the middle of a song when meeting friends or family. The music automatically turns off and starts playing again when put on. With this function you can pause and then get right back to the music.


SWITCH EARPADS

There are no hard decisions whether to buy an on-ear (headphone cushion on ears) or over-ear (headphone cushion fully surrounding ears) headphone. With our flexible switch system you can change earpads and adjust to a studio situation. Feel free to switch whenever you want.





PERSONALIZE

To make the headphone yours. You can brand it with your own name. Any font can be engraved into the silicone patch. If you are interested in buying the headphone with a personalization we will contact you for further information regarding the design. 


SOUND AND MATERIAL

Besides functionality we also set our focus on sound quality and material. We decided to analyze the best leading headphones and optimize our system to get the best sound possible. We are very happy with the result. Besides this we knew from the start that we did not want to create a standard product. That is why we started mixing materials such as metal and oil finished rubber plastic to achieve a smooth and valuable feeling.


CONTROLS

For quick and easy handling we installed invisible control points. Why invisible? To keep the design simple.



- To PAUSE and PLAY a song press the middle.

- To go to the next song press forward (right side). To go back a song press back (left side).

- To increase or decrease the volume, simply press up or down.








First Sketches


First Renders


Choice of material



Timeline



Team

«We are very happy with the result. And of course we thought of everything. We will send you a package full of extras such as a transport case so you can enjoy the full essence of our passion. The product is ready so now we need your support to share this passion with the world. Thank you for your support!»

Yannick & Erik




Risks & Challenges

Projects often come hand in hand with risks and challenges. But we are ready for them and have already taken care of a lot of risks before hand. The retail prototype has been confirmed and the product is ready for production. Our challenge is now to achieve our goal so we can deliver our product to the world. We all know that waiting is an annoying part of buying products online. We can although promise that our team will manage to keep all deadlines that are ahead. We work hard to satisfy our customers in anyway because we owe them a thank you for helping us realize B&B Air.

story:
My name is Ed Filowat and I am the creator of kilojam. I’ve been obsessed with video and music making technology for my entire life. When I was a kid, I had a Commodore computer and small collection of Casio keyboards. I would stay up late at night trying to recreate Phil Collins  songs.   I dreamed of being a musician, but I disliked  the idea of performing. So, when I got older, I chose to focus on my other passion, programming.    

Kilojam began as a simple website that I built in 2007 to listen to music at work. Back then, kilojam played randomized music videos from YouTube along with visual backgrounds of stars and mountains. I named it kilojam after my namesake "reddy kilowatt."  It was a hit among family and friends. 

I always wanted make kilojam interactive. So, when the iPhone was born years later, I immediately made kilojam into a theramin app. You could shake the phone and the song would speed up or slow down or twist it and it would change pitch. This wasn't something that anyone wanted to do for more than 30 seconds, but it sowed the seeds for the modern day kilojam.

Many versions of kilojam followed over the years as I worked on it in my spare time, constantly striving to improve it. Many times, I was discouraged because of the limitations of the iPhone to process graphics and sound.

As the technology and the iPhone capabilities improved I was able to make it to do more interesting things with sounds and visuals. 

The time has now come to finally  launch it: 

Kilojam is unique in that it  allows you to compose music from any sound and visual source and do it in real time, giving the user much more freedom of artistic expression. It is a musical instrument with infinite creative possibilities.

Now that kilojam is on the App Store, I need some help to make the next phase  a reality.  I foresee it as a "kiloverse" where people can interact with each others' creations. I would  like to bring a back-end expert on board to build social features and also sound and visual designers to collaborate on fresh monthly content.  Improve the performance of the app, and begin the arduous task of android development. 

Regardless of whether or not you can help out financially, try out kilojam and let me know what you think of it!
story_txt: My name is Ed Filowat and I am the creator of kilojam. I’ve been obsessed with video and music making technology for my entire life. When I was a kid, I had a Commodore computer and small collection of Casio keyboards. I would stay up late at night trying to recreate Phil Collins  songs.   I dreamed of being a musician, but I disliked  the idea of performing. So, when I got older, I chose to focus on my other passion, programming.    Kilojam began as a simple website that I built in 2007 to listen to music at work. Back then, kilojam played randomized music videos from YouTube along with visual backgrounds of stars and mountains. I named it kilojam after my namesake "reddy kilowatt."  It was a hit among family and friends. I always wanted make kilojam interactive. So, when the iPhone was born years later, I immediately made kilojam into a theramin app. You could shake the phone and the song would speed up or slow down or twist it and it would change pitch. This wasn't something that anyone wanted to do for more than 30 seconds, but it sowed the seeds for the modern day kilojam.Many versions of kilojam followed over the years as I worked on it in my spare time, constantly striving to improve it. Many times, I was discouraged because of the limitations of the iPhone to process graphics and sound.As the technology and the iPhone capabilities improved I was able to make it to do more interesting things with sounds and visuals. The time has now come to finally  launch it: Kilojam is unique in that it  allows you to compose music from any sound and visual source and do it in real time, giving the user much more freedom of artistic expression. It is a musical instrument with infinite creative possibilities.Now that kilojam is on the App Store, I need some help to make the next phase  a reality.  I foresee it as a "kiloverse" where people can interact with each others' creations. I would  like to bring a back-end expert on board to build social features and also sound and visual designers to collaborate on fresh monthly content.  Improve the performance of the app, and begin the arduous task of android development. Regardless of whether or not you can help out financially, try out kilojam and let me know what you think of it!
